title: tar_extract
description: Extract files from a tar archive

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

output.description: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.output`, example: `output_folder`. Folder to restore file(s) to
output.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.output`, example: `output_folder`. Folder to restore file(s) to.

strip_components.description: Type: `integer`, example: `1`. Strip this amount of leading components from file names on extraction
strip_components.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `1`. Strip this amount of leading components from file names on extraction. For example, to extract only 'myfile.txt' from an archive containing the structure `this/goes/deep/myfile.txt', use 3 to strip 'this/goes/deep/'.

exclude.description: Type: `string`, example: `docs/figures`. Prevents any file or member whose name matches the shell wildcard (pattern) from being extracted
exclude.help_text: Type: `string`, example: `docs/figures`. Prevents any file or member whose name matches the shell wildcard (pattern) from being extracted.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
